The poem also indicates clearly the tendencies of the age. It is a protest against the degrading influences of impure super· stitions3 against the sham and increasing degeneracy of society3 against the reckless, mad ambitions and ceaseless ferment oi political life. In a period grossly material in tastes and enjoy- ments, when great fortunes were being rapidly made and were ever bringing new luxuries iu their traiu, it bids men take refuge and find true happiness in higher thingS, in pleasures of the soul rather than the body. The mission ol Lucretius was to set forth the atomic Materialism as it appeared acceptable rothe Roman mind and adapted to meet the needs of the Roman character fora philosophy of life and rule of duty.
